section.para: To access the To-Do List, select the "To-Do List" option. The following screen will appear:

note.para: Black type indicates the To-Do has been completed—or it is due on the current day. Red To-Dos are late. Green To-Dos are not yet due.

listitem.para: Select to display To-Do List items for all users.
Select user whose To-Do List items you want to display.
Enter a user pattern to select a range of users.
Select to include only active To-Do List items in the display.
Select to include completed To-Do List items in the display.
Select to include Incidents in the display.
To-Dos due on or after this date will be included in the display.
To-Dos due on or before this date will be included in the display.
Incidents created on or after this date will be included in the display.
Incidents created on or after this date will be included in the display.
Display lists To-Do List items, using the specified parameters.
Select to automatically update the display every five minutes.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Highlight a To-Do List item and then select this button to move the To-Do List item up the list. Sequence numbers are user-defined and must be manually assigned.
Highlight a To-Do List item and then select this button to move the To-Do List item down the list. Sequence numbers are user-defined and must be manually assigned.
Opens screen for creating a new To-Do List item.

Enables you to edit highlighted To-Do List items. The edit screen is the same as that for creating a new To-Do List item—except that when editing, the fields will contain To-Do List item information. Double-clicking on a To-Do List item will also bring you to the editing screen.
Highlight a To-Do List item and then select this button to reach a read-only view of the "Edit" screen.
Highlight a To-Do List item and then select this button to remove the To-Do List item from the list.
Runs the report associated with this screen.
